content: snail + teacup designs reversible honeycomb cowl craft tunisian crochet difficulty intermediate appx time 5-8 hours us terminology materials ● yarn a 100 yards of worsted weight yarn solid ● yarn b 100 yards of worsted weight yarn solid or variegated ● us k-10 5/6 5 mm double ended tunisian crochet hook ● yarn needle ● scissors shown in yarn a malabrigo rios 100% superwash merino wool black yarn b malabrigo rios 100% superwash merino wool medusa gauge in tunisian honeycomb pattern 14 sts and 15 row over 4 inches after blocking reversible honeycomb cowl by snail + teacup designs llc fwdp forward pass down to the other end of your hk with yarn hk hook b drape the yarn over the hook leaving a tail lp s loop s long enough to weave in and pull the yarn repeat repeat through one lp on your hook to attach from retp return pass here through the end of the project the sl slip_stitch return pass is worked by yarning over and st s stitch es pulling through two lps stop when you have tss tunisian simple stitch 4 or 5 lps on your hook then turn your work tps tunisian purl stitch back to the right side slide the lps down to yo yarn over the other end of the hook and continue picking up lps in the bb of your starting chain when you have picked up a lp in the bb of all notes the starting chains you will be at the the reversible honeycomb cowl is worked beginning of round 2 in the round in a continuous spiral you can round 2-24 *tss tps * repeat from * to * use a locking stitch marker to mark the first across the whole round stopping to turn stitch of each round if you like but it is not your work and complete return pass sts as necessary in this pattern as you will simply necessary continue the same stitch repeat round after bind off after completing all forward pass round sts of round 24 or when your cowl reaches if you wish to adjust the size of your cowl your desired height turn to complete return simply change the length of the starting pass sts stopping when just two lps remain chain being sure to chain an odd number on your hook cut yarn b leaving a 5 - 6 inch note this may change the yardage needed tail then yo and pull that tail through the last for the cowl lp of yarn a on your hook using a slip_stitch bind off all sts in pattern directions foundation round 1 with yarn a chain 89 being sure not to twist slip_stitch into the first chain made to make
